meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of prokaryotes.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the prokaryotic cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: Bacteria are a common example of prokaryotic organisms.
meanings.sent3: The prokaryotic microbes threw a tiny party in the petri dish.
meanings.sent4: In the vast ocean of biology, prokaryotic life forms are like hidden treasures waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The prokaryotic nature of the single-celled organism made it resilient to extreme conditions.

meanings.definition: Of or pertaining to a prokaryote.
meanings.sent1: The prokaryotic structure of the cell lacked a nucleus.
meanings.sent2: Prokaryotic DNA is not enclosed within a membrane.
meanings.sent3: The prokaryotic community of bacteria had a potluck dinner.
meanings.sent4: The simplicity of prokaryotic organisms is like a minimalist painting in nature's gallery.
meanings.sent5: The prokaryotic characteristics of the microbe allowed it to adapt quickly to changes.

meanings.sent1: The pond water teemed with various prokaryotic species.
meanings.sent2: A prokaryotic cell is structurally different from a eukaryotic cell.
meanings.sent3: The prokaryotic critters in the soil danced under the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: The prokaryotic world is like a microscopic universe full of tiny wonders.
meanings.sent5: A microscope revealed the intricate details of the prokaryotic organism.
